results.title: The Good wife of Tokyo
results.creator_credit: Claire Hunt, Kim Longinotto, Channel Four and Twentieth Century Vixen
results.brief_description: When Kazuko Hohki goes back to Tokyo with her avant-garde band, the ‘Frank Chickens’, after living in England for fifteen years, she decides to marry her boyfriend of ten years to please her mother. This wryly observed documentary records her re-experiencing of Japan after a long absence, examining traditional and contemporary attitudes to women and the unconventional lives of her friends. Focusing on Kazuko’s mother and other women who have joined a religion known as ‘The House of Development’, which encourages feelings of self-confidence and individuality the film provides a fresh perspective on the lives of women in contemporary Japanese society. In Japanese with English subtitles.

results.title: Can the earth provide?
results.creator_credit: Donald Fraser, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Earth and mankind”.
When the earth’s capacity to produce meat and potatoes, wheat, rice or corn is exhausted, will science be able to feed us? Sea plankton, algae, hydroponics, synthetics - all hold great potential for development. But the vital questions are: How much? How soon? Animation: Rene Jodoin, Kaj Pindal Narrated by Stanley Burke.

results.title: The Global struggle for food
results.creator_credit: Donald Fraser and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Earth and mankind”.
A progress report on efforts to stave off the threatening crisis in world food supply, to find new ways of feeding the earth’s swelling population. Water control, land redistribution, agricultural advances of all kinds are shown as examples of gains being made to stem the tides of hunger.

results.title: Challenge to mankind
results.creator_credit: Donald Fraser, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Earth and mankind”.
Five world-renowned authorities voice their opinion on the threat to mankind of overpopulation, and tender some possible solutions. Views are expressed by Madam Pandit of India, Paul Hoffman of the United States, Lord Boyd Orr of the United Kingdom, Dr Victor Belaunde of Peru and Dr Hugh Keenleyside of Canada. Animation by Rene Jodoin and Kaj Pindal. Narrated by Stanley Burke.

results.title: To each a rightful share
results.creator_credit: Donald Fraser, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Earth and mankind”.
This, to the privileged, is a fine-sounding principle; but to the underprivileged it is a call to action. Riots in Africa, India’s violence, China’s new dynamism, Japan’s intense industrialization - all these are seen as part of a great movement. Good historical overview of the rise of industrialization, with particular emphasis on the social affects (the growth in wealth brought on by industrialization).

results.title: The Good Fight
results.creator_credit: Sam Sills, Mary Dore and Noel Buckner
results.brief_description: An excellent political documentary about more than three thousand Americans who joined the Abraham Lincoln Brigade to fight in the Spanish Civil War from 1936-1939, although their participation was frowned upon in many quarters in America at the time. Newsreel clips, anecdotes from veterans, and a Hollywood film, “Blockade”, are deftly edited together to produce this valuable ennobling history lesson. Rated: G

results.title: The Earth and mankind
results.brief_description: A series of six films which provide a comprehensive survey and review of the world’s population and food supply. The films show that already the problem transcends national boundaries, threatening man’s survival.

results.title: The Gondoliers, or, The King of Barataria
results.brief_description: Recorded live at the Sydney Opera House, March 2, 1989 this operetta by Gilbert and Sullivan is considered one of the best Savoy Operas. Marco and Giuseppe Palmien are two Venetian gondoliers, one of whom is also the rightful King of Barataria, since no-one knows which of them is the rightful King, they both have a chance to put their republican principles into practice by sharing the throne. But it is then revealed that in fact neither of them is truly the king. This operetta satirises republican principles and the libretto has been modified to contain present-day references. Performed by The Australian Opera Chorus and The Elizabethan Philharmonic Orchestra. Performers include: Stephen Bennett, Jeffrey Black, Gillian Sullivan, Donald Shanks, David Hobson. The Australian Opera Chorus conducted by Gyorgy Fischer. Recorded as part of Esso night at the opera.

results.title: The Global warming. Parts 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: Mark Redhead, Jean-Marc Seban, London Weekend Television and Vision Group
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Climate & man”.
Global Warming and the Greenhouse Effect are no longer unknown scientific concepts. They affect all people on the globe, and the prevention of further deterioration of the environment and atmosphere are critical issues facing governments. This comprehensive examination of the the causes and implications of greenhouse and global warming also looks at possible strategies which will in time slow down the devastation caused by these phenomena.

results.title: ACMI in the regions: Stories from Horsham Shire
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, Jessica Scott and ACMI
results.brief_description: Down Victoria’s Western Freeway, to the north of the Grampians, lie three towns that help to make up Horsham Shire. The towns of Horsham, Natimuk and Laharum are all from the same region, but, in meeting the locals, we get to see what truly makes these unique towns tick and why the locals wouldn’t want to live anywhere else.
